dcterms:description: VisDial v0.9 is a dataset collected via Amazon Mechanical Turk, where two subjects chat about an image. One subject can only see the image caption and asks questions about the hidden image, while the other has access to both the image and caption to answer the questions. The dataset contains a total of 1,232,870 dialog question-answer pairs on MSCOCO images.
dcterms:title: VisDial v0.9

dcterms:creator: Abhishek Das
Satwik Kottur
Khushi Gupta
Avi Singh
Deshraj Yadav
José MF Moura
Devi Parikh
Dhruv Batra
dcterms:description: VisDial v1.0 is an updated version of the VisDial dataset, which includes all the data from VisDial v0.9 along with additional dialog question-answer pairs. It is used to evaluate visual dialog systems.
dcterms:title: VisDial v1.0

dcterms:creator: Unnat Jain
Svetlana Lazebnik
Alexander G Schwing
dcterms:description: VisDial-Q is a dataset designed to test the questioner side of visual dialog, built upon the VisDial v0.9 dataset. It includes a retrieval-based evaluation protocol where a visual dialog system must choose one out of 100 next questions for a given question-answer pair.
dcterms:title: VisDial-Q

dcterms:creator: Tsung-Yi Lin
Michael Maire
Serge Belongie
James Hays
Pietro Perona
Deva Ramanan
Piotr Dollár
C Lawrence Zitnick
dcterms:description: MSCOCO is a large-scale dataset that contains images with annotations for object detection, segmentation, and captioning. It serves as a foundational dataset for various computer vision tasks.
dcterms:title: MSCOCO
